main event: A UFO sighting occurred in Woodside, California during the summer of 1955, and a detailed report was filed with Project Blue Book, a U.S. Air Force program that investigated unidentified flying objects (UFOs) in the 1950s.
interesting points: The sighting was reported by a 7-year-old youth and was reported 0 years later, suggesting that the witness waited until they were older to report the sighting.

The object was described as a small circular object in the sky with a hazy grayish appearance, moving at a tremendous speed and suddenly stopping before changing direction at an extremely fast rate of speed.
The object was estimated to be 7 to 10 times the speed of a jet, and the distance from the witness was considered impossible to estimate.
The mysterious object was reported to have a silver, metallic color with gray, shiny spots on it, and it did not produce any sound.

The apparent attempts to understand the nature of the sighting, such as estimating the speed and distance of the object and providing details about its appearance and behavior, reflect the thoroughness of the investigation.
sighted object: a small circular object with a hazy grayish appearance
